title: Keen Patches
content: I'm wondering if there's a central repository of Keen patches somewhere, nicely laid out a grouped and stuff or whether they're all just acattered around various forums.Wombat is my little donation to all the crazy people who do stuff with old games.  [url=http://www.szevvy.com]www.szevvy.com[/url]

title: Re: Keen Patches
content: I am working on a patch collection which should have grouping, tagging and XML exporting for possible use in a future automated patching program; however, I'm desperately trying to focus on a single project at the moment - not something I find easy at the best of times - so when I'm done with that (a couple of weeks if I'm lucky) I'll resume work.[url=http://toxicsheep.com]toxicsheep.com[/url] | [url=http://commanderkeen.org]coming up next...[/url]

title: Re: Keen Patches
content:
LevelLord has a good collection here:
[url=http://levellord.toxicsheep.com/Index/]levellord.toxicsheep.com/Index/[/url]

She should have more of that somewhere, but I couldn't find the link for some reason!3D Realms: "Do you think there'll ever be a sequel to your game(s)?"
Tom Hall: "If I owned Keen, there sure would be. I don't consider that GBA game canon by any means."

title: Re: Keen Patches
content: On a completely unrelated note, szevvy, is your website down?  I've been trying to get on it for days, and the link continually tells me that "Page cannot be found".

title: Re: Keen Patches
content: I haven't paid my domain name fees and must wait ~4 more days before the domain becomes unlocked.Wombat is my little donation to all the crazy people who do stuff with old games.  [url=http://www.szevvy.com]www.szevvy.com[/url]
